approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. NOTE: If `value` is the maximum `uint256`, the allowance is not updated on `transferFrom`. This is semantically equivalent to an infinite approval. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

decimals().details: The number of decimals of the wrapper token is the same as the number of decimals of the underlying token.

returns._0: The number of decimals of the wrapper token.

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

returns._0: A boolean indicating whether the transfer was successful.

params.amount: The amount of shares to transfer.

returns._0: A boolean indicating whether the transfer was successful.
The address of the underlying token.

params.amount: The amount of this ERC20 token to unwrap.
params.receiver: The address to receive the underlying tokens.

returns._0: True if the operation was successful.

params.amount: The amount of the underlying token to wrap.
params.receiver: The address to receive the wrapped tokens.

returns._0: True if the operation was successful.

decimals().notice: Returns the number of decimals of the wrapper token.

transfer(address,uint256).notice: Transfers a certain amount of tokens to a recipient.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).notice: Transfers a certain amount of tokens from a sender to a recipient.

underlying().notice: Returns the address of the underlying ERC20 token.

unwrap(uint256,address).notice: Unwraps the specified amount of this ERC20 token back into the underlying token.

wrap(uint256,address).notice: Wraps the specified amount of the underlying token into this ERC20 token.

documentation.text:
@notice Returns the address of the underlying ERC20 token.
 @return The address of the underlying token.
